title: Ruling on the one who deliberately misses Fajr and offers prayer after Sunrise, is prayer valid?
transcript: cd from germany um what's the ruling of a person who doesn't what doesn't want to wake up for visual prayer and he can wake up fresh prayer like using the alarm or waking up by a person but he doesn't want it and he always wakes up after sunset is his vision prayer valid or not do you mean sunrise not sunset i hope it's not sunset anyways i mean sorry okay okay i will answer inshallah sidi from germany if someone does not take any preparations to wake up for fajr rather he deliberately prohibits people from waking him up to pray and he doesn't set the alarm clock to pray this person's prayer after sunrise is invalid whether he pray it or not it doesn't make any difference allah will not accept it from him and unfortunately the vast majority of muslims are like this they they do not set the alarm clock except at seven o'clock or eight o'clock to go to work or for university but not for prayer they deliberately skip fajr prayer they cannot pray fajr it's gone as they cannot pray it one minute before the adhan they cannot pray it after the time is over if they skipped it deliberately you
